meta.title: AI Introduction To C Sharp
meta.path: quizzes/Computer Science/1/2/Programming 1/AI Introduction to C Sharp.json

questions.q: Who developed the C# programming language?
questions.explanation: C# was developed by Microsoft as part of its .NET initiative.

questions.q: Which symbol is used to end most lines of code in C#?
questions.explanation: Just like a period ends a sentence, a semicolon ends a statement in C#.

questions.q: How do you write a single-line comment in C#?
questions.explanation: Two forward slashes tell the compiler to ignore the rest of the line.

questions.q: Which data type would you use to store a whole number like 25?
questions.explanation: 'int' stands for integer, which represents whole numbers.

questions.q: What is the standard command to print text to the screen in a console app?
questions.explanation: Console.WriteLine() moves to a new line after printing the text.

questions.q: True or False: C# is an Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) language.
questions.explanation: C# is built around the concept of 'objects' and 'classes'.

questions.q: True or False: C# is case-sensitive, meaning 'Variable' and 'variable' are different.
questions.explanation: The computer treats capital and lowercase letters as distinct characters.

questions.q: True or False: A 'string' data type is used to store true or false values.
questions.explanation: A 'bool' stores true/false; a 'string' stores text.

questions.q: True or False: The 'Main' method is where a C# program starts execution.
questions.explanation: Every C# console application must have a Main method as its entry point.

questions.q: True or False: C# code must be compiled before it can be run.
questions.explanation: Compilation turns your human-readable code into something the machine can understand.

questions.answer: A class is a blueprint or template for creating objects, defining the data and behavior they will have.

questions.q: What is the purpose of a 'Variable'?
questions.answer: A variable is a named storage location in memory used to hold data that can be changed during program execution.
